item.title: Ashley Greene Loses Her Beloved Dog in Condo Fire
item.description: Twilight star Ashley Greene's West Hollywood condo went up in flames today after someone left a candle unattended. Greene, her brother, and her boyfriend (who might be Ryan Phillippe?) were all asleep at the time. One of Greene's two fox terriers didn't survive. More »
item.dc:creator: Lindy West

item.title: Vagina Murder Gate: The Tweet That Launched 1,000 Quips
item.description: In today's Tweet Beat, Amanda Bynes' monumental decision to broadcast her desire that Drake "murder [her] vagina" continues to reverberate through the universe, LL Cool J and Paris Hilton tweet the same Ralph Waldo Emerson quote (Who Tweeted It Better?), and, on a sadder note, Twitter says goodbye to celebrated author Chinua Achebe. More »
item.dc:creator: Callie Beusman

item.title: It’s Not Just Pretty White Girls Who Sext, But You’d Never Guess That From the Media
item.description: Everybody sexts. Or, to be more precise, men and women sext, gay and straight people sext, trans and gender-queer folks sext, people of all races, sizes, and (almost all) ages sext. As new research unveiled this week reveals, this impressive diversity, however is almost entirely hidden by the way print media represents sexting across the English-speaking world. As far as newspapers and magazines are concerned, it seems sexting has only one face: that of a pretty, white, teenage girl. The coverage resembles the worst impulses of high school sex-ed, journalist and scholar Nina Funnell says: "girls are reduced to victims or sluts, boys are assumed to be aggressors, and same-sex couples get ignored all together." More »
item.dc:creator: Hugo Schwyzer

item.title: Urology Clinic Offers March Madness Deal on Vasectomies, Throws in a Free Pizza
item.description: Huh? More »
item.dc:creator: Lindy West

item.title: New Report Suggests Women Don't Have the Ballin' Investment Portfolios (or Crushing Debt) Men Have
item.description: A new report about the sundry ways American men and women nurture their personal finances suggests that women aren't daring enough with their investment portfolios. Financial prudence may seem like a virtue, but some money wizards would really like to appropriate Sheryl Sandberg's "lean in" phraseology and see women become more aggressive in the giant conceptual casino we benignly call "the stock market." More »
item.dc:creator: Doug Barry

item.title: 25 Burning Questions I Have About Vagina Murder
item.description: At 9:15pm Thursday night, my evening was on a romcom heroine pre-makeover trajectory — stretchy inside-pants donned, computer open, a half eaten 1 lb bag of Red Vines on my bed, and a Pac Man tumbler of white wine on the bedside table. There may or may not have been string cheese involved (I'm gross!). When suddenly, a Tweet appeared in my feed that Changed Everything. More »
item.dc:creator: Erin Gloria Ryan

item.title: Happy Endings Is the Best Sitcom on TV and No One Is Watching It
item.description: Have you been watching ABC's Happy Endings? Probably not and you know how I know that? Because no one watches it! It's constantly on the brink of getting cancelled which is a goddam tragedy seeing as no sitcom on TV right now has more laugh-out-loud moments than this one. More »
item.dc:creator: Madeleine Davies

item.title: Women Profiled in 'Feminist Housewives' Piece Say 'New York' Misquoted and Misrepresented Them
item.description: Kelly Makino and Rebecca Woolf, two of the women featured in New York's bogus trend piece about "feminist housewives" who are "having it all by choosing to stay home," say the magazine prevaricated its portrayal of them to fit into its agenda: an "antidote" to Sheryl Sandberg's Lean In that would be sure to gin up controversy. Jezebel spoke with both women about how their stories and words got twisted into "leaning out." More »
item.dc:creator: Tracie Egan Morrissey

item.title: TGIF: Show Us Your Squee!
item.description: The little polar bear cub born at the Buffalo Zoo back in November has been out and about lately! In this video, she goes on an outdoor romp, playing in the snow. The clip is ten minutes long, but there's lots of adorable running around starting at 3:29 and when she gets a belly rub at 4:22 you will squee your head off. Via Zooborns. Below, post your own squee-worthy kitten videos clips, puppy gifs and whatever else ya got. Friday! More »
item.dc:creator: Dodai Stewart

item.title: Producers Seek 'Quick-Tempered Coquette' for the Jodi Arias Movie
item.description: Are you a twenty-something Caucasian woman who is "coquettish, head-turning, with a palpable sexy allure and well aware of the affect she has on men"? Congrats! You could play Jodi Arias in the Lifetime movie, which is "definitely" in the works, according to ABC News. More »
item.dc:creator: Dodai Stewart

item.title: March Madness Day 4: The One With the Rachel
item.description: 80s vs. 90s March Madness barrels along with Valley girls knocking perms out of the running in the 80s bracket and Game Boys taking it on like Donkey Kong to defeat 90210 on the 90s side of the tracks, which reminds me — are you guys fucking serious? Game Boy over 90210? Despite my disappointment in you, the competition continues. Onward! More »
item.dc:creator: Madeleine Davies

item.title: Watch a Kickass 13-Year-Old Girl Bench Press 240 Lbs. and Grin About It
item.description: You guys, 13-year-old Maryana Naumova — who hails from Russia — is freaking strong. In this clip, she bench-presses 220 lbs., then 230, then 240. Apparently her form is terrible? According to YouTube haters? Here's what I know: Her smile — and dip-dyed hair — are awesome. More »
item.dc:creator: Dodai Stewart

item.title: Fuck, Marry, Kill: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
item.description: Friends, we live in a dark, uncertain world. War, famine, prejudice, disease—sometimes the swirling tide of confusion is so strong that we fear we may be washed away entirely. And that's why Jezebel is passionately committed to chipping away at life's toughest and most overwhelming questions. Why are we here? Who, in our society, should be the arbiter of right and wrong? Why is space so big? And, of course, which sarcastic anthropomorphic turtle-child do you most want to have intercourse with!? More »
item.dc:creator: Lindy West

item.title: Former French President in Trouble for Possibly Exploiting Demented L'Oreal Heiress
item.description: Nicolas "Bling Bling" Sarkozy, former President of La France, spouse of the immeasurably calm Carla Bruni, and deadringer for Mickey Mouse, is currently at the center of an inquiry into whether he took advantage of Liliane Bettencourt, the 90-year-old L'Oreal heiress, for some campaign financing after she was already certified as demented. Questions about whether Sarkozy took advantage of France's second richest and finest smelling person come at a particularly inconvenient time for the diminutive former president, with rumors flooding the French media that Sarkozy has been eyeing another presidential run in the wake of his recent defeat at the hands of socialist do-gooder Francois Hollande. More »
item.dc:creator: Doug Barry

item.title: Kate Upton Cannot Specifically Recall Doing A Vogue Cover Shoot Recently
item.description: Kate Upton swears she has "no idea" if she's going to be on the cover of American Vogue in June, as rumored. "I have no idea what's happening," she says. "I feel like it's easier to deal with my schedule just one day at a time." You know, we forget a lot of things — keys, sex partners, certain moments from the summers of 2008 and 2009 — but we are pretty sure we'd remember doing a Vogue cover shoot. It just seems like the kind of thing that, having done it, you wouldn't forget. It's worth mentioning that Upton was speaking at a Samsung event; in an interview pitch sent to numerous blogs, a Samsung publicist last week volunteered that the model could speak about "her upcoming Vogue cover in June." [Esquire] More »
item.dc:creator: Jenna Sauers

item.title: Mass Effect 3 Writer: More People Should Be Creating Complex Female Video Game Characters
item.description: We so often receive dismally sexist news from the wide world of pixelated galavanting that a gem like the recent blog post from Mass Effect 3 scribe Ann Lemay feels especially precious. More »
item.dc:creator: Doug Barry

item.title: Kate Middleton Hangs With Cub Scouts, Roasts Entrails Snacks Over Open Fire
item.description: Catherine, Duchess of Cambridge, went on a wintry jaunt to Windermere today, where she hung out a the Great Tower Scout camp. We assumed she was roasting the entrails of her enemies — quite good for nourishing the royal fetus — but apparently it's traditional unleavened camping bread. Yum? More »
item.dc:creator: Dodai Stewart

item.title: Just Shut the Fuck Up About Kim Kardashian's Weight
item.description: Even before 32-year-old Kimberly Noel Kardashian got pregnant, her weight was a talking point. Her curvy body — and that infamous derrière — landed her on magazine covers, and she was paid handsomely to use and promote the non-FDA-approved weight loss supplement QuickTrim. But now that Kim is with child, the blaring, critical headlines about her body have reached a nauseating fever pitch. It's cruel, disgusting, sexist, and it's got to stop. More »
item.dc:creator: Dodai Stewart

item.title: Cherry Blossom Nails: Because Even Your Fingers Are Craving Spring
item.description: Much unlike many a magazine editor who recommends you buy all sorts of crap that they most likely got for free, your Jezebel staff doesn't get jack shit (other than books, unsolicited). And that's how it should be. But on our own time, in our personal lives, we still buy stuff. So this is Worth It, our recommendation of random things that we've actually spent our own money on. These are the things we buy regularly or really like, things we'd actually tell our friends about. And now we're telling you. More »
item.dc:creator: Madeleine Davies

item.title: Cheesecake, the Stoic Capybara, Faces Threat From Puppies
item.description: Cheesecake is at it again — this time in motion! That Cheesecake, always keeping it stoic like a distinguished gentlemen at a criminal hearing. Cheesecake didn't do it! (Unless the crime was being very adorable — and then guilty as charged!) More »
item.dc:creator: Laura Beck

item.title: Douchey Nebraska Political Consultant Fired for Calling Legislator a ‘Cunt’ on Facebook
item.description: In his zeal to help prove his undying bro loyalty to Nebraska State Sen. Charlie Janssen, a "political consultant" named Jeremy Jensen deployed on of the last truly offensive bad words in the English language, calling Democratic legislator Danielle Conrad a "cunt" on his Facebook page. Jensen was promptly fired. More »
item.dc:creator: Doug Barry

item.title: Queens-Based Spelling Wunderkind Has One Last Shot at the National Bee
item.description: Arvind Mahankali was barely five years old when he first set out to win at the Scripps National Spelling Bee, though of course, it took him about four years to actually make it there. Arvind first competed in the competition at the age of nine (he was eliminated on the word "Presa") and has returned every year since, eventually managing to place third. This year, he's headed to Scripps again only now the stakes are a little higher because, at 13, this is the last time he will be eligible to compete. More »
item.dc:creator: Madeleine Davies

item.title: Sane Republicans Exist, and They Need to Make Their Party See the Rainbow Writing on the Wall
item.description: Some Republicans are having a change of heart about same-sex marriage — not tons, and not even a remarkable amount, but a few are. Last week, GOP Senator Rob Portman, citing influence from his gay son, said "I now believe that [gay] people ought to have the right to get married." He joined GOP members of the House Ileana Ros-Lehtinen and Richard Hanna, and it warmed our little gay marriage-loving hearts. Because it's a wonderful thing; they are on the right side of history, and they're not going to be humiliated in the AP American Government textbooks of the future. More »
item.dc:creator: Laura Beck

item.title: Smith College Rejects Transgender Applicant Thanks to Shitty Admissions Policies
item.description: Calliope Wong, a student currently winding down her time at Amity Regional Senior High School in Connecticut, believed her application to Smith College (a women's liberal arts college in Northampton, Mass. that used to be a husband-hunting lodge for wealthy, straight white women and now boasts a queer population upwards of 20 percent of the student body) would get a fair evaluation. Correspondence over the summer with Smith's Dean of Admission Debra Shaver seemed to imply as much, but on March 10, Wong received an extra shitty rejection letter: her application to Smith wouldn't be considered because Wong, a male-to-female transsexual girl, wasn't recognized as female in her home state, and, therefore, still listed as male on her federal financial aid application. More »
item.dc:creator: Doug Barry

item.title: Singapore Government Uses 'Fairytales' to Chide Women About Biological Clocks
item.description: A new government-funded campaign in Singapore is educating young women about declining fertility through a series of illustrated "fairytales," distributed on university campuses, that retell classic stories that result in some kind of moral lesson for women who ignore the ticking of their biological clocks. More »
item.dc:creator: Tracie Egan Morrissey
